sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"丢脸，羞愧"之意。
means: shame ： 多指因非法婚烟、私生、卖国或犯法等而丢失脸面或败坏名声，使他人认为"丢脸"、"可耻"。
disgrace ： 常指失去他人的尊敬和称赞而使自己感受到的丢脸、耻辱。
embarrassment ： 多指在社交活动中所遇到的尴尬事。
dishonour ： 指失去原来享有的光荣或自尊和自重。

sentence.Network_en: She turned scarlet from embarrassment, once she realized what she had done.
sentence.Network_cn: 她意识到自己做了什么后羞红了脸。

sentence.Network_en: The facts could cause embarrassment if they ever became public.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦披露出去，真相会让人非常尴尬。

sentence.Network_en: The report has caused acute embarrassment to the government.

entry.def: Embarrassment is the feeling you have when you are embarrassed.

example.ex: It is a source of embarrassment to Londoners that the standard of pubs is so low...
example.tran: 酒馆水准之低让伦敦人觉得颜面尽失。

example.ex: I think I would have died of embarrassment...
example.tran: 我觉得自己难堪得要死。

entry.def: An embarrassment is an action, event, or situation which causes problems for a politician, political party, government, or other public group.

example.ex: The poverty figures were undoubtedly an embarrassment to the president.
example.tran: 贫困数字毫无疑问让总统非常难堪。

entry.def: If you refer to a person as an embarrassment, you mean that you disapprove of them but cannot avoid your connection with them.

example.ex: You have been an embarrassment to us from the day Douglas married you.
example.tran: 从道格拉斯娶你那天起，你就让我们非常难堪。

entry.tran: 好东西太多而成了问题
entry.def: If you say that someone has an embarrassment of riches, you mean that they have so many good things that these things are a problem.

example.ex: The art gallery's problem is an embarrassment of riches, with nowhere to put most of them.
example.tran: 那家美术馆的问题是好作品太多，大多数作品无处陈放。

means.word_mean: 1. the shame you feel when your inadequacy or guilt is made public
2. the state of being embarrassed (usually by some financial inadequacy);
3. some event that causes someone to be embarrassed;

sentences.sentence: "the outcome of the vote was an embarrassment for the liberals"

auth_sentence.content: The fact they don't work is an embarrassment.
auth_sentence.res_content: The fact they don't work is an embarrassment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The fact they don't work is an embarrassment.

auth_sentence.content: Inhofe has been an embarrassment for many years now.
auth_sentence.res_content: Inhofe has been an embarrassment for many years now.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Inhofe has been an embarrassment for many years now.

auth_sentence.content: It is a very great embarrassment, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a very great embarrassment, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a very great embarrassment, he said.

sentences.en: He could not hide his embarrassment.
sentences.cn: 他无法掩盖自己的窘态。

sentences.en: The episode was a huge embarrassment for all concerned.
sentences.cn: 这段小插曲令所有有关人员都感到非常尴尬。

means.word_mean: 富人的苦恼；好东西太多无法作选择

sentences.en: Stratford has an embarrassment of riches, what with three theatres and lovely countryside too.
sentences.cn: 斯特拉福特值得游览的地方太多了，有三家剧院，还有可爱的乡村。
